answers.answer: For fever, you can take ibuprofen (Advil) or acetaminophen (Tylenol). Decongestants and expectorants such as dextromethorphan and guaifenesin can worsen your COPD. Depending on the severity of your COPD, you might be able to take them. Please discuss your options with your physician.

question: I have diabetes 2 and copd and past heart attacks, what over the counter cold meds can I take safely?
title: What OTC Cold Meds to take?
